text:
The JUnit task has two types of formatting at the moment; you either get a 
summary, which hides all the details, or you get a verbose listing, which has 
all the data. We found a need for a "middle-ground", which hides the data for 
successes (which are in the majority), but shows the detail for failures and 
errors.
creator: robert.watkins@qsipayments.com
robert.watkins@qsipayments.com
text:
Created attachment 68
Patches to the JUnit Task classes to implement the enhancement.

creator: robert.watkins@qsipayments.com
text:
Created attachment 69
New class needed to implement the enhancement.

The provided files implement a "brief" option. To use, you specify a formatter 
type of "brief" (as opposed to "plain" or "xml").

While users could implement this functionality on their own, I believe this 
would be a useful contribution to the base JUnit functionality in Ant.
creator: robert.watkins@qsipayments.com
bodewig@apache.org
text:
I have two problems with your patch:

(1) The smaller issue - You don't get the names of the failed tests - this would
be written in startTest (quite easy to fix).

(2) The bigger issue - the license.  Everything we put into Ant's repo has to be
licensed by the Apache Software License.  If you want to contribute your code,
fine - if not, somebody will need to reimplement it.

creator: robert.watkins@qsipayments.com
